010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianFilterSeparable;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.Eigensolver2x2;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class implements the Anisotropic Diffusion filter described in [1].
023 * It is based on an earlier C++ (CImg) implementation (pde_TschumperleDeriche2d.cpp) by the original
024 * author, made available under the CeCILL v2.0 license 
025 * (http://www.cecill.info/licences/Licence_CeCILL_V2-en.html).
026 * See Sec. 17.3.5 of [2] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] D. Tschumperle and R. Deriche, "Diffusion PDEs on vector-valued images", 
030 * IEEE Signal Processing Magazine, vol. 19, no. 5, pp. 16-25 (Sep. 2002).
031 * <br>
032 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
033 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @version 2021/01/06 (complete rewrite from scratch)
037 * @version 2022/09/09 added zero-gradient check
038 */
039
040public class TschumperleDericheFilter extends GenericFilter implements TschumperleDericheF {
041
042        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
043        
044        private final Parameters params;
045        private int M;                          // image width
046        private int N;                          // image height
047        private int K;                          // number of color channels (any, but typ. 1 or 3)
048        
049        // temporary data
050        private PixelPack Dx, Dy;       // maps for x/y gradients
051        private PixelPack G;            // structure matrix as (u,v) with 3 elements
052        
053        private GenericFilter filterDx, filterDy;
054        private GenericFilter gradientBlurFilter;
055        private GenericFilter structureBlurFilter;
056        
057        private int iterations;         // number of iterations
058        private float alpha;
059        private double a0, a1;
060        private PixelPack source, target;
061        
062        
063        public TschumperleDericheFilter() {
064                this(new Parameters());
065        }
066        
067        public TschumperleDericheFilter(Parameters params) {
068                this.params = params;
069        }
070        
071        @Override
072        protected void initFilter(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) { // called by {@link GenericFilter}
073                this.source = source;
074                this.target = target;
075                
076                this.M = source.getWidth(); 
077                this.N = source.getHeight(); 
078                this.K = source.getDepth();
079                
080                this.iterations = params.iterations;
081                this.alpha = params.alpha0;
082                this.a0 = params.a0;
083                this.a1 = params.a1;
084                
085                this.Dx = new PixelPack(source, false); // container for X/Y-derivatives
086                this.Dy = new PixelPack(source, false);
087                
088                this.filterDx = new LinearFilter(Constants.kernelDx);
089                this.filterDy = new LinearFilter(Constants.kernelDy);
090                
091                this.gradientBlurFilter = new GaussianFilterSeparable(params.sigmaD);   
092                this.structureBlurFilter = new GaussianFilterSeparable(params.sigmaM);
093                
094                this.G = new PixelPack(M, N, 3, null);  // structure matrix as (u,v) with 3 elements    
095        }
096        
097        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
098        
099        @Override
100        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
101                makeGradients();                                                        // Step 1
102                makeStructureMatrix();                                          // Step 2
103                float maxVelocity = updateImage();                      // Step 3
104                alpha = (float) params.dt / maxVelocity;        // Step 4: re-adjust alpha
105        }
106        
107        // ------------------------------------------------------------
108        
109        private void makeGradients() {
110                // x-gradients:
111                source.copyTo(Dx);
112                filterDx.applyTo(Dx);
113                gradientBlurFilter.applyTo(Dx);
114                // y-gradients:
115                source.copyTo(Dy);
116                filterDy.applyTo(Dy);
117                gradientBlurFilter.applyTo(Dy);
118        }
119        
120        private void makeStructureMatrix() {    // make M
121                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
122                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
123                                final float[] dx = Dx.getPix(u, v);
124                                final float[] dy = Dy.getPix(u, v);
125                                float g0 = 0; float g2 = 0; float g1 = 0;
126                                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
127                                        final float fx = dx[k];
128                                        final float fy = dy[k];
129                                        g0 += fx * fx;
130                                        g1 += fy * fy;
131                                        g2 += fx * fy;
132                                }
133                                G.setPix(u, v, g0, g2, g1);
134                        }
135                }
136                structureBlurFilter.applyTo(G);
137        }
138
139        private float updateImage() {
140                float betaMax = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;        // maximum velocity
141                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
142                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
143                                // calculate the local geometry matrix A(u,v), which has only 3 distinct elements
144                                float[] A = getGeometryMatrix(u, v);
145                                if (A != null) {
146                                        float[] p = source.getPix(u, v);
147                                        for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
148                                                float[] H = getHessianMatrix(k, u, v); // local Hessian for channel k at pos u,v (3 elements)
149                                                float beta = A[0] * H[0] + 2 * A[1] * H[1] + A[2] * H[2]; // = trace (A*H)
150                                                betaMax = Math.max(betaMax, Math.abs(beta)); // find max absolute velocity for time-step adaptation
151                                                // update the image (result goes to target)
152                                                p[k] = p[k] + alpha * beta;     // we use alpha from the previous pass!
153                                        }
154                                        target.setPix(u, v, p);
155                                }
156                        }
157                }
158                return betaMax;
159        }
160        
161        private float[] getGeometryMatrix(int u, int v) {
162                float[] Guv = G.getPix(u, v); // 3 elements of local geometry matrix (2x2)
163                
164                if (Matrix.isZero(Guv)) {
165                        return null;    // if Guv (gradients) are zero, the geometry matrix is undefined
166                }
167                
168                // calculate the 2 eigenvalues lambda1, lambda2 and the greater eigenvector e1
169                Eigensolver2x2 solver = new Eigensolver2x2(Guv[0], Guv[1], Guv[1], Guv[2]);
170                if (solver.hasComplexEigenvalues()) {
171                        throw new RuntimeException("undefined eigenvalues in " + 
172                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
173                }
174                double lambda0 = solver.getRealEigenvalue(0);
175                double lambda1 = solver.getRealEigenvalue(1);
176                double[] evec0 = solver.getEigenvector(0).toArray();
177                
178                Matrix.normalizeD(evec0);       //  normalize eigenvector to unit length;
179                
180                double arg = 1.0 + lambda0 + lambda1;   // 1 + lambda_1 + lambda_2
181                float c0 = (float) Math.pow(arg, -a0);
182                float c1 = (float) Math.pow(arg, -a1);
183                
184                // mount geometry matrix A:
185                float x0 = (float) evec0[0];
186                float y0 = (float) evec0[1];
187                float xx0 = x0 * x0;
188                float xy0 = x0 * y0;
189                float yy0 = y0 * y0;
190                
191                float A0 = c0 * yy0 + c1 * xx0;
192                float A1 = c0 * xx0 + c1 * yy0;
193                float A2 = (c1 - c0)* xy0;
194                return new float[] {A0, A2, A1};
195        }
196
197        // Calculate the Hessian matrix Hk for channel k at position (u,v)
198        private float[] getHessianMatrix(int k, int u, int v) {
199                float[] Hk = new float[3];
200                PixelSlice Ik = source.getSlice(k);
201                float icc = Ik.getVal(u, v);
202                Hk[0] = Ik.getVal(u-1,v) + Ik.getVal(u+1,v) - 2 * icc;                                                          // = H_xx(u,v)
203                Hk[1] = 0.25f * (Ik.getVal(u-1,v-1) + Ik.getVal(u+1,v+1) - Ik.getVal(u-1,v+1) - Ik.getVal(u+1,v-1));    // = H_xy(u,v)
204                Hk[2] = Ik.getVal(u,v+1) + Ik.getVal(u,v-1) - 2 * icc;                                                          // = H_yy(u,v)
205                return Hk;
206        }
207        
208        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------

215//                      }
216//              }
217//      }
218        
219        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
220        
221        @Override
222        protected final int passesRequired() {
223                return iterations;      // this filter needs T passes
224        }
225        
226        @Override
227        // cleanup temporary data (probably unnecessary)
228        protected void closeFilter() {
229                this.Dx = null;
230                this.Dy = null;
231                this.G = null;
232        }
233
234}
